com.ames.uncover

Class UncoveringDataModel<ITEM>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ames.uncover.UncoveringDataModel<ITEM>

  • public class UncoveringDataModel<ITEM>
extends java.lang.Object
    Central class of implementation, providing the fast model for viewing from one side and grouped/async interface from another side.

    The model is itself the DataAvailableListener, but would also propagate the data available event to the view for repainting,

    • Method Detail

      • isFirstQueryResult

        public boolean isFirstQueryResult()
        Internal method used by data fetch manager

      • setPrimaryDataProvider

        public void setPrimaryDataProvider(PrimaryDataProvider provider)

      • setQuery

        public void setQuery(Query query)
        Set the query for the data, shown by this model. The query is provided to your primary data fetcher when requesting the data. After the new query is set, the model is invalidated, requesting all data to be newly loaded.
        Parameters:
        query - the query to set

      • getPageSize

        public int getPageSize()
        Get the configured paga size
        Returns:

      • setPageSize

        public UncoveringDataModel setPageSize(int pageSize)
        Set the configured page size (the number of items wanted in requests). This must be set before the model is used and cannot be modified later.
        Parameters:
        pageSize - the number of items per request

      • getPage

        public int getPage(int position)
        Get the number of the page for the given position
        Parameters:
        position - the position in the model
        Returns:
        the number of the page

      • getLoadingPlaceHolder

        public ITEM getLoadingPlaceHolder()
        Get the item returned to indicate data are still being loaded. If not set, null is used.

      • setLoadingPlaceHolder

        public UncoveringDataModel setLoadingPlaceHolder(ITEM loadingPlaceHolder)
        Set the item returned to indicate data are still being loaded. If not set, null is used.

      • getItem

        public ITEM getItem(int position)
        Get item at the given position. If the value is not known, returns loading place holder and starts fetching the data segment in the background.
        Parameters:
        position - position of the item to get
        Returns:
        item at the given position.

      • requestPage

        protected void requestPage(int page)
        Request the content for the given position. Expanding strategies must be applied and then the data fetcher must be invoked.
        Parameters:
        page - the page currently missing data.

      • setDataFetcher

        public UncoveringDataModel setDataFetcher(DataFetchManager dataFetcher)
        Internal method.

      • size

        public int size()
        Get the number of items in the model. If not explicitly set, applies the best guess.
        Returns:
        number of items in the model.

      • dataAvailable

        public void dataAvailable(AvailableSegment<ITEM> segment)
        Invoked by data fetcher when data become available.
        Parameters:
        segment - - the segment of now newly available data.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset the model, making the data set empty.

      • lowMemory

        public void lowMemory()
        This can be called on low memory conditions to drop the cached data.

      • getSearchCompleteListener

        public SearchCompleteListener getSearchCompleteListener()

      • setSearchCompleteListener

        public UncoveringDataModel setSearchCompleteListener(SearchCompleteListener searchCompleteListener)
        Set the search listener that is fired when the data fetcher returns the first results. Can be used to hide the progress indicator, enable submit query button and things the like.

      • getQuery

        public Query getQuery()
        Get the currently set query

      • setLayoutManager

        public UncoveringDataModel setLayoutManager(LinearLayoutManager layoutManager)
        Optionally set layout manager to handle the expired areas.

      • getLayoutManager

        public LinearLayoutManager getLayoutManager()
        Internal method used by data fetch manager.

      • setState

        public void setState(java.io.Serializable state)
        Set the state that is required to support Android life cycles. If items are serializable, they are stored as part of state.

      • getState

        public java.io.Serializable getState()
        Get the state that is required to support Android life cycles. If items are serializable, they are stored as part of state.

      • install

        public void install(RecyclerView recyclerView,
                    RecyclerView.Adapter adapter)
        The main method to configure recycler view, its adapter and this model to work together. This method must be called once during the initialization. It wires all listeners and adds some other internal classes
        Parameters:
        recyclerView - the view that will work with this model
        adapter - the adapter that will work with this model
